test.file_name: 01. VCS PD v4.2 - Timor-Leste ICS Project_REV_clean
test.summary: The core idea of the document is that the Timor-Leste Improved Cookstoves and Community Development Project aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and improve community well-being by distributing energy-efficient cookstoves, replacing traditional three-stone stoves, with the support of the Timor-Leste government and in collaboration with Ecosecurities and Emissions Asset Management.

The core idea of the document is to outline a project aimed at reducing woodfuel consumption and greenhouse gas emissions in Laos by distributing 600,000 energy-efficient Improved Cooking Stoves (ICS) to households, thereby improving public health, reducing deforestation, and contributing to sustainable development.

The core idea of the document is to describe the project for the distribution and installation of high-efficiency wood-burning cookstoves in Thailand to replace traditional, inefficient cookstoves, aiming to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, deforestation, and indoor air pollution while improving health and economic conditions for the local population.

The core idea of the document is to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and deforestation in Madagascar by distributing 100,000 fuel-efficient Tsinjoharena cookstoves, improving cooking efficiency and reducing reliance on non-renewable biomass, thus benefiting the environment and local communities.

test.file_name: Kenya Jiko Kisasa ICS Program VCS PD_Clean
test.summary: The Kenya Jiko Kisasa Improved Cookstove Program aims to distribute 100,000 fuel-efficient cookstoves to rural households in Kenya over two years to replace traditional, inefficient cooking methods, thereby reducing greenhouse gas emissions and deforestation while contributing to sustainable development goals.

test.file_name: Project Deisgn Document Version 04 - Clean copy
test.summary: The core idea of the document is to facilitate clean cooking practices and reduce health risks among tribal and below-poverty-line households in Maharashtra by disseminating improved cook stoves, thereby reducing greenhouse gas emissions, conserving fuel wood, and preventing forest degradation.

test.file_name: Project Design Document Version 04 - Clean copy (2)
test.summary: The core idea of the project described in the document is to facilitate clean cooking practices and reduce indoor air pollution among tribal and below poverty line households in Maharashtra by distributing improved cook stoves, thereby reducing greenhouse gas emissions, conserving fuel wood, and preventing forest degradation.

test.file_name: Project Design Document Version 04 - Clean copy
test.summary: The core idea of the document is to facilitate clean cooking practices among tribal households and families living below the poverty line in Maharashtra by disseminating improved cook stoves, thereby reducing indoor air pollution, household drudgery, greenhouse gas emissions, and preventing forest degradation.

test.file_name: Project Design Document Version 04. - Clean copy
test.summary: The core idea of the document is to promote clean cooking practices and reduce health risks and environmental degradation by distributing improved cook stoves to tribal and below poverty line households in rural Maharashtra, thereby reducing greenhouse gas emissions and conserving fuel wood.

The document outlines the plan for distributing improved cook stoves to rural households in Maharashtra, aiming to reduce health risks from indoor air pollution and greenhouse gas emissions, conserve fuel wood, and improve living standards for Below Poverty Line (BPL) and Scheduled Tribe (ST) families.

The core idea of the document is to describe the Global Cookstove Program (Phase 24) by EKI Energy Services Limited, which aims to distribute fuel-efficient improved cookstoves in India to replace traditional low-efficiency stoves, thereby reducing greenhouse gas emissions, improving public health, and contributing to sustainable development.

The core idea of the document is to outline the implementation and benefits of distributing high-efficiency wood-burning cookstoves to approximately 250,000 households in South Africa to improve fuel efficiency, reduce greenhouse gas emissions, and enhance public health and environmental sustainability.

The document outlines the project to distribute and install approximately 500,000 high-efficiency wood-burning cookstoves in Ghana, aiming to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by replacing traditional, inefficient open-fire cooking methods.

The document details the Core Carbon Program's initiative to distribute improved cooking stoves to rural households in Odisha and Jharkhand, aiming to reduce carbon emissions, deforestation, and indoor air pollution while enhancing the livelihoods and health of local communities.

The core idea of the document is to implement a project that distributes fuel-efficient Improved Cook Stoves (ICS) to rural households in the Sabarkantha and Patan districts of Gujarat, India, to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, improve health conditions, and enhance the quality of life for the rural population by providing a safer and more efficient cooking method.

The core idea of the document is the implementation of a project by Climate Detox Private Limited to distribute 50,000 fuel-efficient Improved Cook Stoves (ICS) in the rural Banaskantha District of Gujarat, India, aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions, improving health conditions, and promoting sustainable development.

The document outlines the "Madagascar Improved Cookstove Project" by Korea Carbon Management Ltd., which aims to disseminate energy-efficient cookstoves to rural households in Madagascar, reducing firewood consumption and greenhouse gas emissions while improving health conditions through better indoor air quality.

The document outlines the implementation of the "Viet Nam Improved Cookstove Project by KCM" in Yen Bai Province, which aims to distribute 26,000 energy-efficient improved cookstoves to reduce firewood consumption, lower greenhouse gas emissions, conserve forests, and improve indoor air quality and health for local households.

The document details a project implemented by Korea Carbon Management Ltd. in Phu Tho Province, Viet Nam, aimed at distributing 28,000 energy-efficient improved cookstoves to rural households to reduce firewood consumption, mitigate greenhouse gas emissions, and improve indoor air quality, contributing to sustainable development and better health outcomes.

The document details the implementation and benefits of a project involving the distribution of 500,000 high-efficiency wood-burning cookstoves in Zambia, aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions, improving fuel efficiency, and mitigating deforestation and health hazards from indoor smoke pollution.

The core idea of the document is to describe a project in Bangladesh aimed at distributing 1.6 million fuel-efficient improved cookstoves to replace traditional stoves, thereby reducing greenhouse gas emissions and improving air quality and health conditions for households relying on non-renewable wood fuel.

The core idea of the document is the implementation of a project to distribute and install approximately 300,000 high-efficiency wood-burning cookstoves in Gambia, aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions, improving fuel efficiency, and enhancing health and environmental outcomes.

The document describes a project for distributing fuel-efficient improved cookstoves (ICS) in Mozambique to replace traditional open fire cooking methods, aiming to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, deforestation, and indoor air pollution while promoting social and economic sustainability through reduced fuel consumption and local employment opportunities.

The core idea of the document is to outline the details and methodology for D.Light's Improved Cooking Project in Kenya, which aims to disseminate energy-efficient improved cookstoves to replace traditional cookstoves in domestic households and communities, thereby reducing greenhouse gas emissions and indoor air pollution while promoting sustainable development.

The core idea of the document is to outline the implementation and benefits of the ReNew Sakhi project, which aims to distribute energy-efficient improved cookstoves to replace traditional stoves in India, thereby reducing greenhouse gas emissions, improving indoor air quality, and contributing to sustainable development goals.
